description: An insecure strcpy call (0x00408e74) was found in the http_cgi_main function (0x00408acc), which copies user-controlled input data into a stack buffer without sufficient length checking. This may lead to a buffer overflow vulnerability, allowing attackers to exploit this vulnerability through carefully crafted HTTP requests to execute arbitrary code or cause service crashes.
At 0x00408c64, another unsafe strcpy call was identified, similarly lacking input length validation. This call is also triggered when processing HTTP request parameters.
code_snippet:
0x00408c64      f882998f       lw t9, -sym.imp.strcpy(gp)
0x00408c68      dc00a427       addiu a0, sp, 0xdc
0x00408c6c      9d00a527       addiu a1, sp, 0x9d
0x00408c70      09f82003       jalr t9
0x00408c74      000040a0       sb zero, (v0)
